H0.text: The weight of the box is greater than the force of friction, which explains why the box begins to move when a student pushes it across the floor.

H1.text: The weight of the box is less than the force of friction explains why the box begins to move when a student pushes it to slide across the floor.

H2.text: The applied force is greater than the force of friction, explaining why the box begins to move when a student pushes it to slide across the floor.

H3.text: The applied force is less than the force of friction, which explains why the box begins to move when a student pushes it across the floor.

A5.text: the net force on a body is equal to the body's acceleration multiplied by its mass or, equivalently, the rate at which the body's momentum is changing with time
